definition: variant of 連貫|连贯[lian2 guan4]
to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet
to pierce through/to pass through/to be stringed together/string of 1000 cash

sentences.english: These points being taken together, this report proves to be feasible.
sentences.chinese: 这些要点联贯一致，这篇报告证明是可行的。

definition: to link up/to join together/to connect
to link up (disparate elements)/coherent (narrative, argument etc)
variant of 連綴|连缀[lian2 zhui4]
(feng shui) beneficial influence, esp. from one's ancestral graves/to confer a beneficial influence
if you lift the headrope the meshes spread open (idiom)/take care of the big things and the little things will take care of themselves/(of a piece of writing) well-structured and ordered
to transmit a document (up or down a chain of bureaucracy)
variant of 勾連|勾连[gou1 lian2]
to hold by the hand/fig. to nurture/to foster/to bring up/to support
to concentrate on the main points (idiom); to bring out the essentials
context/the surrounding words/same as 上下文
